snippet: The world golf rankings, with a two-year rolling points system, are the rare perch offering athletes a place to rest on their laurels.
abstract: World golf rankings, with a two-year rolling points system, face scrutiny as golfers prepare for the Players Championship; under existing calculations, No 2 Adam Scott would be better off, mathematically speaking, skipping the Players Championship in order to pass No 1 Tiger Woods, who is injured, in the standings.
lead_paragraph: The world golf rankings, with a two-year rolling points system, are the rare perch offering athletes a place to rest on their laurels.

headline.main: Still No. 1? Golf Rankings Reflect a Longer View
headline.print_headline: Still No. 1? Rankings Reflect a Longer View
